alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Douglas; Haralson; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Paulding, northeastern Haralson, northeastern Carroll and northwestern Douglas Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Draketown, or 10 miles southwest of Dallas, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Villa Rica, Temple, Yorkville, Draketown, Lake Val-Do-Mar and New Georgia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
